admin.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this record?
admin.confirmDeleteTypeWithFields: Delete user type "{{name}}"? This will also delete {{count}} associated field(s).

setup.title: Configure Your Instance
setup.subtitle: Customize the branding and user onboarding experience
setup.instanceSectionDesc: Set the name, icon, and colors shown across your instance.
setup.displayNameHint: This name appears in the header and onboarding screens
setup.userSectionDesc: Configure user types and the questions users answer during onboarding.
setup.userTypesHint: Define different user types to show type-specific onboarding questions. If you have more than one type, users will choose their type during onboarding.
setup.onboardingFieldsHint: Create the questions users answer during onboarding.
setup.knowledgeBaseHint: Upload documents to build your RAG knowledge base for AI-powered responses.
setup.databaseHint: View and manage your instance data directly in the SQLite database.

instanceConfig.title: Instance Configuration
instanceConfig.subtitle: Control branding, chat style, and theme settings for your instance.
instanceConfig.chatIconsDesc: Set the default icons used in chat messages.
instanceConfig.logoPreviewHint: Preview (falls back to the selected icon).
instanceConfig.faviconHint: Shown in the browser tab and bookmarks (recommended 32x32 or 64x64).
instanceConfig.appleTouchIconHint: Used when adding to the iOS home screen (recommended 180x180).
instanceConfig.headerDesc: Control how your instance appears in the top header.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutIconNameDesc: Show both the icon and instance name.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutIconOnlyDesc: Minimal header with just the icon.
instanceConfig.headerLayoutNameOnlyDesc: Text-only header with the instance name.
instanceConfig.headerTaglinePlaceholder: Short descriptor shown under the name
instanceConfig.headerTaglineHint: Leave blank to hide the tagline.
instanceConfig.chatIdentityDesc: Set the labels shown above chat messages.
instanceConfig.chatIdentityHint: Leave a label empty to hide it.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleDesc: Choose the shape and depth of chat bubbles.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleSoftDesc: Rounded corners with a subtle chat feel.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleRoundDesc: Extra-round bubbles with a friendly shape.
instanceConfig.bubbleStyleSquareDesc: Sharper corners for a structured look.
instanceConfig.bubbleStylePillDesc: Full pill style for a bold look.
instanceConfig.surfaceDesc: Pick the background texture for your instance.
instanceConfig.surfaceGradientDesc: Subtle gradient glow in the background.
instanceConfig.surfaceGridDesc: Faint grid for a technical vibe.
instanceConfig.statusIconsDesc: Choose how status updates are displayed.
instanceConfig.statusIconsMinimalDesc: Compact glyphs with a light touch.
instanceConfig.typographyDesc: Pick a font pairing for the entire interface.

userConfig.title: User Configuration
userConfig.subtitle: Configure user types and the questions users answer during onboarding.

database.title: Database Explorer
database.subtitle: View and manage SQLite data
database.selectTable: Select a table from the sidebar

fields.globalHint: Global fields are shown to all users. Type-specific fields only appear for that user type.
fields.placeholderHint: Hint text shown in the input
fields.dataSecurityIntro: Choose how this field's data is stored. This affects both security and AI personalization capabilities.
fields.encryptedHint: Field values will be encrypted with NIP-04 (recommended)
fields.plaintextHint: Field values will be stored in plaintext (not recommended for sensitive data)
fields.encryptedSummary: This field is encrypted. Only an admin with the corresponding Nostr private key can decrypt and view the data.
fields.encryptedNoAI: AI personalization is not available for encrypted fields.
fields.securityWarningBody: Disabling encryption will store user data in plaintext. Only disable for non-sensitive fields like preferences or public information.
fields.plaintextAIOption: Since this field is unencrypted, you can optionally share it with the AI assistant:
fields.includeInChatHint: Share this field's value with the AI assistant to personalize responses
fields.aiPersonalizationBody: The AI assistant will see this field's value to provide more relevant, personalized responses to users.
fields.encryptionHelpDesc: Encryption protects sensitive user data by scrambling it before storage.
fields.encryptionHelpPoint1: Data is encrypted using the admin's Nostr key (NIP-04)
fields.encryptionHelpPoint2: Only the admin can decrypt and view the data
fields.encryptionHelpPoint3: Reduces exposure in some database breach scenarios, but does not eliminate risk
fields.encryptionHelpPoint4: Cannot be shared with the AI assistant
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint1: Data is stored as readable plaintext
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint2: Anyone with database access can read it
fields.encryptionHelpDisabledPoint3: Can be shared with AI for personalization
fields.encryptionHelpRecommendation: Recommendation: Keep encryption enabled for any personally identifiable information (names, emails, phone numbers, addresses).
fields.complianceAcknowledgeLabel: I confirm this field can be stored in plaintext and/or shared with AI under our applicable legal requirements.
fields.complianceAcknowledgeHint: Enable this only after updating your user notices, consent flows (if required), and internal data-handling policies.
fields.complianceAcknowledgeRequired: You must confirm legal/compliance responsibility before saving this field configuration.

errors.saveFailed: Failed to save settings. Please try again.

adminOnboarding.title: Admin Setup
adminOnboarding.subtitle: Connect with your Nostr identity to manage this instance
adminOnboarding.installExtension: Install a NIP-07 compatible extension to continue
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyIntro: After connecting with Nostr, follow this simple setup path:
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep1: Secure access: set public URLs, disable simulation flags outside development, and choose user approval rules.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep2: Set data boundaries: collect only needed fields, keep sensitive fields encrypted, and limit chat context fields.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyStep3: Validate and monitor: run config validation, check service health, and review stored data regularly.
adminOnboarding.securityJourneyNote: This gives you a strong baseline for production.
adminOnboarding.legalResponsibilityNotice: You are responsible for lawful configuration, user disclosures, and data-handling policies for this instance.

nostr.whatIsNostrDesc: Nostr is a decentralized protocol for social networking and identity. Unlike traditional logins, your identity isn't controlled by any company — you own your keys.
nostr.whatIsNip07Desc: NIP-07 is a standard that lets websites request your Nostr public key from a browser extension. This means:
nostr.step1: Install a Nostr signing extension (we recommend Alby)
nostr.step3: Approve the connection in your extension
nostr.dontHaveExtension: Don't have a Nostr extension? Get one here:

userType.title: What describes you best?
userType.description: Select the option that best fits your needs
userType.loadError: Failed to load user types. Please try again.

language.title: Choose your language
language.subtitle: Select your preferred language to continue
language.changeInSettings: You can change this later in your settings.
language.dataHandlingNoticeBody: Sanctum supports passwordless sign-in and encryption-capable profile settings. Final data handling, retention, and AI-sharing behavior are configured by this instance administrator.
language.privacyNoticeBody: Sanctum uses passwordless sign-in and encryption-first profile settings. Final data-handling choices are configured by this instance administrator.

auth.welcomeBackSubtitle: Sign in to continue where you left off
auth.magicLinkHelp: We'll send you a magic link to sign in — no password needed.
auth.sentMagicLink: We sent a magic link to
auth.clickLink: Click the link in the email to sign in.
auth.checkSpam: Don't see it? Check your spam folder.
auth.noPasswordBody: You sign in with a one-time link, so there is no password database to manage.
auth.expiringLinkBody: Each magic link is signed and expires after 15 minutes.
auth.encryptionBody: Profile fields are encrypted by default, but this instance administrator controls field-level settings and may allow selected data to be stored or shared differently.
auth.adminControlNotice: Data handling is configured by this instance administrator, including what may be stored unencrypted or shared with AI tools.
auth.retentionNotice: Data retention and deletion timelines are set by this instance administrator. Contact them for access, correction, or deletion requests.
auth.noWarrantyNotice: Sanctum software is provided as-is without warranty. Use of this instance is subject to administrator policies.

verify.pleaseWait: Just a moment while we sign you in.
verify.linkExpiredMessage: This magic link may have expired or already been used.

profile.title: Complete Your Profile
profile.subtitle: Just a few more details to get started

pending.title: Pending Approval
pending.heading: Your account is pending approval
pending.message: An administrator will review your registration and approve your access.

emptyState.title: What would you like to know?
emptyState.description: Ask questions about your knowledge base or start a general conversation

suggestedPrompts.documents: What documents are in the knowledge base?
suggestedPrompts.ragPipeline: How does the RAG pipeline work?
suggestedPrompts.entities: What are the main entities and relationships?

tools.label: Tools
tools.webSearch: Search the web for current information

documentScope.title: Knowledge Bases
documentScope.description: Select sources to include in context

adminDashboard.title: Admin Dashboard
adminDashboard.subtitle: Manage your Sanctum instance configuration
adminDashboard.configureSubtitle: These sections control branding, user data collection, AI behavior, deployment security, and stored content.
adminDashboard.securityStep1Body: Set public URLs, disable simulation flags outside development, and choose whether users require approval.
adminDashboard.securityStep2Body: Collect only necessary fields, keep sensitive fields encrypted, and only include safe fields in chat context.
adminDashboard.securityStep3Body: Validate configuration, check service health, secure email and HTTPS settings, and review stored records regularly.
adminDashboard.instanceDesc: Branding, chat style, and theme settings
adminDashboard.userDesc: Define user types and onboarding questions
adminDashboard.aiDesc: Configure prompts, LLM parameters, and document defaults
adminDashboard.deploymentDesc: Manage environment settings and service health
adminDashboard.uploadDesc: Add documents to your knowledge base
adminDashboard.databaseDesc: Browse and query the SQLite database

adminAI.title: AI Configuration
adminAI.subtitle: Control how the AI behaves and responds to your users
adminAI.promptTemplateDesc: Shape how the AI communicates with your users
adminAI.promptTemplateHint: These settings define the AI's personality and boundaries. Changes take effect immediately for new conversations.
adminAI.parametersHint: These technical settings affect response speed and quality. The defaults work well for most use cases — only adjust if you notice issues.
adminAI.sessionDefaultsDesc: Set which features are on by default
adminAI.sessionDefaultsHint: Control which AI capabilities are enabled when users start a new chat session.
adminAI.documentDefaultsDesc: Control which documents the AI can reference
adminAI.documentDefaultsHint: Documents marked "Available" can be selected by users. Documents marked "Active by Default" are automatically included in new conversations.

adminDeployment.title: Deployment Configuration
adminDeployment.subtitle: Manage your server connections and infrastructure settings
adminDeployment.serviceHealthHint: Green means the service is responding normally. If a service shows red, check its configuration below.
adminDeployment.validationStaleDesc: Configuration changed since last validation. Revalidate to confirm.
adminDeployment.leaveEmptyForSecret: Leave empty to keep current value

domainsHelp.overviewDesc: These settings control where your app lives on the internet and how services find each other. Defaults are set for local development.
domainsHelp.whatToSet: Set these when you go live:
domainsHelp.overviewUrl: INSTANCE_URL / API_BASE_URL / ADMIN_BASE_URL for public entry points
domainsHelp.overviewCORS: CORS_ORIGINS to allow your frontend domain
domainsHelp.overviewNote: If you are staying on localhost, you can keep the defaults.
domainsHelp.urlsDesc: Public URLs and CORS origins must match exactly (scheme + domain + port).
domainsHelp.urlsNote: If your API is served from the same domain as the app, you can leave API_BASE_URL empty.
domainsHelp.dnsDesc: These values help you create DNS records for email deliverability.
domainsHelp.dkimExample: Use the selector from DKIM_SELECTOR and the public key from your provider.
domainsHelp.dmarcExample: Example TXT record: v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc@example.com
domainsHelp.dnsNote: Use your email provider's recommended records for best deliverability.
domainsHelp.cdnDesc: Comma-separated CDN hostnames for static assets. Leave blank if not using a CDN.
domainsHelp.webhookDesc: Base URL used to construct webhook callbacks. Use your public API domain.
domainsHelp.searxDesc: Only needed if your SearXNG instance lives on a different host.

upload.title: Upload Documents
upload.subtitle: Add documents to your knowledge base for RAG
upload.dropOrBrowse: Drop file here or click to browse
upload.jobsTimeout: Server is busy processing documents. Try refreshing in a moment.
upload.confirmDeleteDesc: This will permanently remove the document and all its chunks from the knowledge base. This action cannot be undone.

llm.label: AI Provider
llm.hint: Configure which AI service powers your assistant. You'll need an API key from your chosen provider (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic). Changes require a service restart to take effect.

embedding.label: Text Processing
embedding.hint: These settings control how your documents are converted into searchable data. The defaults work well for most cases — only change if you're using a custom model.

email.label: Email Service
email.description: Set up email for user authentication
email.hint: Configure email for sending magic links to users during sign-in. You'll need SMTP credentials from an email service like SendGrid, Mailgun, or your own mail server.

storage.label: Data Storage
storage.hint: Control file paths for the database and uploaded documents. These typically don't need to change unless you're customizing your deployment.

security.label: Security & URLs
security.hint: Set your public URLs and security options. The frontend URL is where users access the app. Make sure these match your actual deployment.

search.label: Web Search
search.hint: Configure the search engine that powers the AI's web search feature. When enabled, the AI can look up current information online.

domains.label: Domain & URLs
domains.description: Configure domain names, URLs, and DNS settings
domains.hint: Use these when moving to a custom domain. Defaults assume local development (localhost). Configure your root domain, public URLs, CORS origins, and email DNS records (DKIM/SPF/DMARC).

ssl.label: SSL & Security
ssl.description: Configure SSL certificates and HTTPS settings
ssl.hint: Configure TLS and proxy settings when serving over HTTPS. Defaults are safe for local dev; enable HTTPS only after certificates are mounted.

general.label: General
general.hint: Miscellaneous settings that don't fit into other categories.

prompt_tone.label: Tone & Personality
prompt_tone.description: How the AI should sound when responding
prompt_tone.hint: This sets the overall voice and manner of the AI. For example, you might want it to be "warm and supportive" for a counseling app, or "concise and professional" for a business tool. The AI will use this as guidance for every response.

prompt_rules.label: Behavioral Rules
prompt_rules.description: Specific instructions the AI must follow
prompt_rules.hint: Add rules as a JSON list like ["Always cite sources", "Keep responses under 200 words"]. These are firm guidelines the AI will try to follow in every conversation.

prompt_forbidden.label: Forbidden Topics
prompt_forbidden.description: Topics the AI should decline to discuss
prompt_forbidden.hint: List topics you want the AI to politely redirect away from. For example, ["medical advice", "legal counsel"]. The AI will acknowledge these requests but explain it cannot help with them.

prompt_greeting.label: Response Style
prompt_greeting.description: How the AI structures its responses
prompt_greeting.hint: Controls formatting preferences like whether to use bullet points, headers, or conversational paragraphs. This affects how answers are visually presented.
prompt_greeting.placeholder: Use bullet points for lists, headers for sections...

temperature.label: Creativity Level
temperature.description: How predictable vs. creative the AI responses are
temperature.hint: Lower values (0.0-0.3) make responses more focused and consistent — good for factual Q&A. Higher values (0.7-1.0) make responses more varied and creative — better for brainstorming. Default: 0.7

top_k.label: Knowledge Depth
top_k.description: How many document sections to reference
top_k.hint: When answering questions, the AI searches your uploaded documents and pulls in relevant sections. Higher numbers mean more context but slower responses. Lower numbers are faster but may miss relevant info. Default: 5

web_search_default.label: Web Search
web_search_default.description: Allow AI to search the internet
web_search_default.hint: When enabled, the AI can search the web for current information not in your documents. Disable this if you want responses to only come from your uploaded knowledge base.

LLM_PROVIDER.label: AI Service
LLM_PROVIDER.hint: Choose "maple" for the Maple proxy (recommended for privacy) or "ollama" for local models.

LLM_MODEL.label: Model Name
LLM_MODEL.hint: The model identifier to use (e.g., "kimi-k2-thinking"). Check your provider's documentation for available models.

LLM_API_URL.label: API Endpoint
LLM_API_URL.hint: The base URL for API requests. For Maple: http://maple-proxy:8080/v1. For Ollama: http://localhost:11434.

RAG_TOP_K.label: Context Chunks
RAG_TOP_K.hint: How many document chunks to retrieve for each query. Higher = more context but slower. Default: 8.

PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.label: PDF Processing
PDF_EXTRACT_MODE.hint: "fast" extracts text quickly. "quality" uses OCR for better accuracy with scanned documents but is slower.

EMBEDDING_MODEL.label: Embedding Model
EMBEDDING_MODEL.hint: The HuggingFace model for converting text to vectors. Only change if you need a different language or domain.

SMTP_HOST.label: Mail Server
SMTP_HOST.hint: Your SMTP server address (e.g., smtp.gmail.com, smtp.sendgrid.net).

SMTP_PORT.label: Mail Port
SMTP_PORT.hint: Usually 587 for TLS or 465 for SSL. Check your email provider's settings.

SMTP_USER.label: SMTP Username
SMTP_USER.hint: Your email service username or API key.

SMTP_PASS.label: SMTP Password
SMTP_PASS.hint: Your email service password or API key secret.

SMTP_FROM.label: Sender Address
SMTP_FROM.hint: The "from" address for outgoing emails (e.g., noreply@yourdomain.com).

MOCK_SMTP.label: Test Mode
MOCK_SMTP.hint: When "true", emails are logged instead of sent. Useful for development.

SQLITE_PATH.label: Database File
SQLITE_PATH.hint: Path to the SQLite database file. Default: /data/sanctum.db

UPLOADS_DIR.label: Uploads Folder
UPLOADS_DIR.hint: Directory where uploaded documents are stored. Default: /uploads

QDRANT_HOST.label: Vector DB Host
QDRANT_HOST.hint: Hostname for the Qdrant vector database. Default: qdrant

SEARXNG_URL.label: Search Engine URL
SEARXNG_URL.hint: URL of your SearXNG instance for web search functionality.

FRONTEND_URL.label: App URL
FRONTEND_URL.hint: The public URL where users access the app. Used for generating magic links.

SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.label: Simulate User Auth
SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.description: Allow user verification without magic link token (testing only)
SIMULATE_USER_AUTH.hint: Enable for development/testing. Allows users to complete email verification without clicking the magic link. Should be disabled in production.

SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.label: Simulate Admin Auth
SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.description: Show mock Nostr connection button for admin auth (testing only)
SIMULATE_ADMIN_AUTH.hint: Enable for development/testing. Shows a "Mock Connection" button on admin login that bypasses Nostr extension requirement. Should be disabled in production.

BASE_DOMAIN.label: Root Domain
BASE_DOMAIN.hint: Root domain without protocol. Example: example.com. Leave blank for local dev.

INSTANCE_URL.label: Application URL
INSTANCE_URL.hint: Public app URL with protocol. Example: https://app.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173.

API_BASE_URL.label: API URL
API_BASE_URL.hint: Only set if API is on a separate domain. Example: https://api.example.com. Default: http://localhost:8000.

ADMIN_BASE_URL.label: Admin URL
ADMIN_BASE_URL.hint: Only if admin UI is on a separate domain. Example: https://admin.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173/admin.

EMAIL_DOMAIN.label: Email Domain
EMAIL_DOMAIN.hint: Domain used for From addresses and DNS records. Example: example.com or mail.example.com.

DKIM_SELECTOR.label: DKIM Selector
DKIM_SELECTOR.hint: Selector prefix for your DKIM TXT record. Default: sanctum. Your provider may require a specific selector.

SPF_INCLUDE.label: SPF Include
SPF_INCLUDE.hint: Replace with your provider include value (e.g., include:sendgrid.net, include:_spf.google.com).

DMARC_POLICY.label: DMARC Policy
DMARC_POLICY.hint: Start with v=DMARC1; p=none; rua=mailto:dmarc@example.com and tighten later.

CORS_ORIGINS.label: CORS Origins
CORS_ORIGINS.hint: Comma-separated full origins (scheme + host). Example: https://app.example.com,https://admin.example.com. Default: http://localhost:5173.

CDN_DOMAINS.label: CDN Domains
CDN_DOMAINS.hint: Comma-separated CDN hostnames for static assets (e.g., cdn.example.com). Leave blank if not using a CDN.

CUSTOM_SEARXNG_URL.label: Custom SearXNG URL
CUSTOM_SEARXNG_URL.hint: Set only if using a separate SearXNG host. Example: https://search.example.com.

WEBHOOK_BASE_URL.label: Webhook URL
WEBHOOK_BASE_URL.hint: Base URL used to construct webhook callbacks. Example: https://api.example.com/webhooks. Default: http://localhost:8000.

TRUSTED_PROXIES.label: Trusted Proxies
TRUSTED_PROXIES.hint: Set to cloudflare, aws, or a comma-separated list of IP ranges. Leave blank if not behind a proxy.

SSL_CERT_PATH.label: SSL Certificate Path
SSL_CERT_PATH.hint: Absolute path to the certificate file. Example: /etc/ssl/certs/fullchain.pem.

SSL_KEY_PATH.label: SSL Key Path
SSL_KEY_PATH.hint: Absolute path to the private key file. Example: /etc/ssl/private/privkey.pem.

FORCE_HTTPS.label: Force HTTPS
FORCE_HTTPS.hint: Set to true only after SSL_CERT_PATH and SSL_KEY_PATH are configured.

HSTS_MAX_AGE.label: HSTS Max Age
HSTS_MAX_AGE.hint: Seconds browsers should enforce HTTPS. Default: 31536000 (1 year). Use 0 to disable.

MONITORING_URL.label: Monitoring URL
MONITORING_URL.hint: Health check URL for external monitors. Default: http://localhost:8000/health.

promptPreview.sampleQuestion: What should I know about this topic?
